titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania LJS 500: Liber mirabilium

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Alchemical and medical compendium containing recipes and texts from a variety of sources, many of which appear with traditional (now suspect) attributions in other manuscripts, with an alphabetical index to recipes at the beginning of the volume. Occasional manicules and annotations added by readers.

msItem.title: Tabula huius libri ad reperiendum capitula, f. 1r
Vita remedia et ordo servandus tempore pestilentie, f. 96r

supportDesc.extent: 100 leaves : 204 x 143 (146 x 88) mm. bound to 210 x 155 mm

collation.p: Parchment, i (modern paper) + 100 + i (modern paper); 1² 2⁶ 3-7¹⁶ 8¹²; every tenth leaf foliated in pencil, lower right recto. Horizontal catchwords with decorative dots, lower center of last verso in gatherings 3-7 (f. 24v, 40v, 56v, 72v, 88v).

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 32-33 long lines; frame-ruled in lead, vertical bounding lines.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in semi-cursive humanistic script by multiple hands, including that of Jeronimus de Sandei of Piran (f. 98v).

decoDesc.decoNote: Opening page of text illuminated with a 10-line historiated initial enclosing a picture of Hermes Trismegistus on gold ground and a three-quarters border of acanthus leaves (border at top slightly trimmed) including the Sandei arms (blue lion rampant) at the bottom of the page (f. 9r); 2 historiated initials in red with blue penwork and the blue lion of the Sandei arms (f. 6r, 39r); 5- and 6-line initials in red with blue penwork or blue with red penwork at the beginning of some component works (f. 13r, 39r, 61v, 96r); 2-line to 5-line initials (a single 7-line initial, f. 87v) in red with blue penwork (faded purple penwork in index) or blue with red penwork throughout; 1-line initials alternating between red and blue and paragraph marks alternating between red and blue throughout. Occasional manicules, mostly by a single reader (f. 13v, 15v, 17v, 18r, 27v, 30v, 31r, 48r; f. 75v, 83v by additional readers).
Historiated initial, Initial P, Hermes Trismegistus, f. 9r
Historiated initial, Initial Q, Blue lion, f. 39r

origin.p: Written in Piran (then under the control of the Republic of Venice, in modern Slovenia), between 1452 (f. 1r) and 1455 (f. 98v). The date 1451 also appears in the manuscript (f. 99v).

history.provenance: Offered for sale at auction at Sotheby's, 5 Dec. 2012, lot 19; sold privately to Lawrence J. Schoenberg, Dec. 2012.
Deposit by Lawrence J. Schoenberg and Barbara Brizdle, 2013.
